thread.title: LSU survives 35-28 thriller over Florida: Notes & numbers
thread.title_full: LSU survives 35-28 thriller over Florida: Notes & numbers | NOLA.com

author: NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: LSU survives 35-28 thriller over Florida: Notes & numbers
text: LSU fullback Bry'Kiethon Mouton started his first game. 17 Tigers have seen their first career playing time this season. Now 6-0 overall and 4-0 in SEC play, this is the fourth time LSU has climbed to that mark overall in Les Miles' 11 seasons. It's also the third time the Tigers are 4-0 in the league in his tenure. With a second straight win against the SEC East, LSU is now 23-9 since Miles arrived against the opposite side of the league and has won 13 of the last 15 games vs. the East. The Tigers rushed for 221 yards on 41 attempts and have now rushed for more than 200 yards in every game this season. With a 28-14 halftime lead on Saturday, LSU has outscored opponents 110-37 in the first half of games this year and that came after 'losing' the first quarter (7-0) for the first time all season. Saturday marked the fourth time since 1948 that the Tigers have scored exactly 28 points in a second quarter. Leonard Fournette rushed for 180 yards on 31 carries and two touchdowns -- his career-high in attempts. He has rushed for multiple touchdowns in five of six games this season and has topped 100 yards in all six and eight in a row overall, one behind Charles Alexander's school-record nine. His performance against Florida ties Fournette with Jeremy Hill for fourth place all-time at LSU with 11 games of 100 yards or more. The 180 yards increased Fournette's career total to 2,236 career rushing yards, which is good for ninth on the program's all-time list. he already has 1,202 rushing yards this season, which is the eight-most through the first six games of a season in FBS history. Brandon Harris threw for 202 yards on 13-for-19 passing and has now thrown for 200 yards in back-to-back games for the first time in his career. With a pair of TD passes to Malachi Dupre , Harris has thrown multiple touchdown passes two game sin a row. LSU veterans knew what to expect from Florida and they got the intense battle they expected | Video He recorded 10 tackles, 2.5 TFL and sack in the victory Dupre hauled in a season-best 115 yards on four catches, his second career 100-plus yard receiving game and first this season. He has caught a touchdown pass in each of the last two games and three of LSU's last four. Trent Domingue's fake field goal touchdown run was the 24th touchdown produced by special teams in Miles' 11-year tenure and the Tigers are 21-2 in games when they reach the end zone with the kicking games. Lewis Neal and Deion Jones each logged 10 tackles to become the first tandem to reach double digits in a game this season. Neal's 10 tackles and 3.5 tackles for loss were both career-highs as were his 3 sacks. Jones also recorded a career-high 2.5 tackles for loss and notched the first full sack of his career. Jalen Mills made his season debut on Florida's first drive of the second quarter at the 12:19 mark.
